title: Kirkcaldy RFC
text:
Kirkcaldy Rugby Football Club is a <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> club from <a href="Kirkcaldy">Kirkcaldy</a>, <a href="Fife">Fife</a>, <a href="Scotland">Scotland</a>. The men's side currently plays in and the women's side currently plays in .
History.
The team was established in 1873 Home games are played at <a href="Kirkcaldy%23Culture">Beveridge Park</a>.
The club hold a community <a href="Rugby%20sevens">sevens</a> tournament annually, with 22 teams taking part in 2014.
Their Samoan head coach, Quintan Sanft, has been with the club since 2005.
Kirkcaldy Sevens.
The club host the Kirkcaldy Sevens tournament. Entrants play for the Heggie Cup.
